member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.Comdlg32
member.summary: API of Comdlg32.dll.

member.name: M:MGS.WinLibrary.Comdlg32.GetOpenFileName(MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName)
member.summary: Creates an Open dialog box that lets the user specify the drive, directory, and the name of a file or set of files to be opened.
member.param: A pointer to an OPENFILENAME structure that contains information used to initialize the dialog box. When GetOpenFileName returns, this structure contains information about the user's file selection.
member.returns: If the user specifies a file name and clicks the OK button, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:MGS.WinLibrary.Comdlg32.GetSaveFileName(MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName)
member.summary: Creates a Save dialog box that lets the user specify the drive, directory, and name of a file to save.
member.param: A pointer to an OPENFILENAME structure that contains information used to initialize the dialog box. When GetSaveFileName returns, this structure contains information about the user's file selection.
member.returns: If the user specifies a file name and clicks the OK button and the function is successful, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName
member.summary: Contains information that the GetOpenFileName and GetSaveFileName functions use to initialize an Open or Save As dialog box. After the user closes the dialog box, the system returns information about the user's selection in this structure.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lStructSize
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the structure. Use sizeof (OPENFILENAME) for this parameter.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.hwndOwner
member.summary: A handle to the window that owns the dialog box. This member can be any valid window handle, or it can be NULL if the dialog box has no owner.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.hInstance
member.summary: If the OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE flag is set in the Flags member, hInstance is a handle to a memory object containing a dialog box template.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrFilter
member.summary: A buffer containing pairs of null-terminated filter strings. The last string in the buffer must be terminated by two NULL characters.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrCustomFilter
member.summary: A static buffer that contains a pair of null-terminated filter strings for preserving the filter pattern chosen by the user.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nMaxCustFilter
member.summary: The size, in characters, of the buffer identified by lpstrCustomFilter. This buffer should be at least 40 characters long. This member is ignored if lpstrCustomFilter is NULL or points to a NULL string.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nFilterIndex
member.summary: The index of the currently selected filter in the File Types control. The buffer pointed to by lpstrFilter contains pairs of strings that define the filters.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrFile
member.summary: The file name used to initialize the File Name edit control. The first character of this buffer must be NULL if initialization is not necessary.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nMaxFile
member.summary: The size, in characters, of the buffer pointed to by lpstrFile. The buffer must be large enough to store the path and file name string or strings, including the terminating NULL character.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrFileTitle
member.summary: The file name and extension (without path information) of the selected file. This member can be NULL.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nMaxFileTitle
member.summary: The size, in characters, of the buffer pointed to by lpstrFileTitle. This member is ignored if lpstrFileTitle is NULL.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrInitialDir
member.summary: The initial directory. The algorithm for selecting the initial directory varies on different platforms.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrTitle
member.summary: A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box. If this member is NULL, the system uses the default title (that is, Save As or Open).

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.flags
member.summary: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input. This member can be a combination of the following flags.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nFileOffset
member.summary: The zero-based offset, in characters, from the beginning of the path to the file name in the string pointed to by lpstrFile. For the ANSI version, this is the number of bytes; for the Unicode version, this is the number of characters.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.nFileExtension
member.summary: The zero-based offset, in characters, from the beginning of the path to the file name extension in the string pointed to by lpstrFile. For the ANSI version, this is the number of bytes; for the Unicode version, this is the number of characters.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpstrDefExt
member.summary: The default extension. GetOpenFileName and GetSaveFileName append this extension to the file name if the user fails to type an extension. This string can be any length, but only the first three characters are appended. The string should not contain a period (.). If this member is NULL and the user fails to type an extension, no extension is appended.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lCustData
member.summary: Application-defined data that the system passes to the hook procedure identified by the lpfnHook member.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpfnHook
member.summary: A pointer to a hook procedure. This member is ignored unless the Flags member includes the OFN_ENABLEHOOK flag.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.lpTemplateName
member.summary: The name of the dialog template resource in the module identified by the hInstance member. For numbered dialog box resources, this can be a value returned by the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. This member is ignored unless the OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE flag is set in the Flags member.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.pvReserved
member.summary: This member is reserved.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.dwReserved
member.summary: This member is reserved.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OpenFileName.flagsEx
member.summary: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. Currently, this member can be zero or the following flag: OFN_EX_NOPLACESBAR.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags
member.summary: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT
member.summary: The File Name list box allows multiple selections. If you also set the OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box uses the Explorer-style user interface; otherwise, it uses the old-style user interface.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_CREATEPROMPT
member.summary: If the user specifies a file that does not exist, this flag causes the dialog box to prompt the user for permission to create the file.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_DONTADDTORECENT
member.summary: Prevents the system from adding a link to the selected file in the file system directory that contains the user's most recently used documents.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ENABLEHOOK
member.summary: Enables the hook function specified in the lpfnHook member.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ENABLEINCLUDENOTIFY
member.summary: Causes the dialog box to send CDN_INCLUDEITEM notification messages to your OFNHookProc hook procedure when the user opens a folder.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ENABLESIZING
member.summary: Enables the Explorer-style dialog box to be resized using either the mouse or the keyboard.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE
member.summary: The lpTemplateName member is a pointer to the name of a dialog template resource in the module identified by the hInstance member.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE
member.summary: The hInstance member identifies a data block that contains a preloaded dialog box template.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_EXPLORER
member.summary: Indicates that any customizations made to the Open or Save As dialog box use the Explorer-style customization methods.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_EXTENSIONDIFFERENT
member.summary: The user typed a file name extension that differs from the extension specified by lpstrDefExt.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST
member.summary: The user can type only names of existing files in the File Name entry field.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_FORCESHOWHIDDEN
member.summary: Forces the showing of system and hidden files, thus overriding the user setting to show or not show hidden files.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_HIDEREADONLY
member.summary: Hides the Read Only check box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_LONGNAMES
member.summary: For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use long file names.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NOCHANGEDIR
member.summary: Restores the current directory to its original value if the user changed the directory while searching for files.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS
member.summary: Directs the dialog box to return the path and file name of the selected shortcut (.LNK) file.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NOLONGNAMES
member.summary: For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use short file names (8.3 format).

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NONETWORKBUTTON
member.summary: Hides and disables the Network button.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NOREADONLYRETURN
member.summary: The returned file does not have the Read Only check box selected and is not in a write-protected directory.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NOTESTFILECREATE
member.summary: The file is not created before the dialog box is closed. This flag should be specified if the application saves the file on a create-nonmodify network share.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_NOVALIDATE
member.summary: The common dialog boxes allow invalid characters in the returned file name.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT
member.summary: Causes the Save As dialog box to generate a message box if the selected file already exists.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST
member.summary: The user can type only valid paths and file names. If this flag is used and the user types an invalid path and file name in the File Name entry field, the dialog box function displays a warning in a message box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_READONLY
member.summary: Causes the Read Only check box to be selected initially when the dialog box is created.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_SHAREAWARE
member.summary: Specifies that if a call to the OpenFile function fails because of a network sharing violation, the error is ignored and the dialog box returns the selected file name.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlags.OFN_SHOWHELP
member.summary: Causes the dialog box to display the Help button. The hwndOwner member must specify the window to receive the HELPMSGSTRING registered messages that the dialog box sends when the user clicks the Help button.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlagsEx
member.summary: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.OFNFlagsEx.OFN_EX_NOPLACESBAR
member.summary: If this flag is set, the places bar is not displayed. If this flag is not set, Explorer-style dialog boxes include a places bar containing icons for commonly-used folders, such as Favorites and Desktop.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.Shell32
member.summary: API of Shell32.dll.

member.name: M:MGS.WinLibrary.Shell32.SHBrowseForFolder(MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo)
member.summary: Displays a dialog box that enables the user to select a Shell folder.
member.param: A pointer to a BROWSEINFO structure that contains information used to display the dialog box.
member.returns: Returns a PIDL that specifies the location of the selected folder relative to the root of the namespace. If the user chooses the Cancel button in the dialog box, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:MGS.WinLibrary.Shell32.SHGetPathFromIDList(System.IntPtr,System.Char[])
member.summary: Converts an item identifier list to a file system path.
member.param: The address of an item identifier list that specifies a file or directory location relative to the root of the namespace (the desktop).
The address of a buffer to receive the file system path. This buffer must be at least MAX_PATH characters in size.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo
member.summary: Contains parameters for the SHBrowseForFolder function and receives information about the folder selected by the user.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.hwndOwner
member.summary: A handle to the owner window for the dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.pidlRoot
F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.pszDisplayName
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer to receive the display name of the folder selected by the user. The size of this buffer is assumed to be MAX_PATH characters.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.lpszTitle
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that is displayed above the tree view control in the dialog box. This string can be used to specify instructions to the user.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.ulFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify the options for the dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.lpfn
member.summary: Pointer to an application-defined function that the dialog box calls when an event occurs.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.lParam
member.summary: An application-defined value that the dialog box passes to the callback function, if one is specified in lpfn.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BrowseInfo.iImage
member.summary: An integer value that receives the index of the image associated with the selected folder, stored in the system image list.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify the options for the dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_RETURNONLYFSDIRS
member.summary: Only return file system directories. If the user selects folders that are not part of the file system, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_DONTGOBELOWDOMAIN
member.summary: Do not include network folders below the domain level in the dialog box's tree view control.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_STATUSTEXT
member.summary: Include a status area in the dialog box. The callback function can set the status text by sending messages to the dialog box. This flag is not supported when BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE is specified.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_RETURNFSANCESTORS
member.summary: Only return file system ancestors. An ancestor is a subfolder that is beneath the root folder in the namespace hierarchy. If the user selects an ancestor of the root folder that is not part of the file system, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_UAHINT
member.summary: When combined with BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE, adds a usage hint to the dialog box, in place of the edit box. BIF_EDITBOX overrides this flag.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_NONEWFOLDERBUTTON
member.summary: Do not include the New Folder button in the browse dialog box.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_NOTRANSLATETARGETS
member.summary: When the selected item is a shortcut, return the PIDL of the shortcut itself rather than its target.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_BROWSEFORCOMPUTER
member.summary: Only return computers. If the user selects anything other than a computer, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_BROWSEFORPRINTER
member.summary: Only allow the selection of printers. If the user selects anything other than a printer, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEFILES
member.summary: The browse dialog box displays files as well as folders.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: The browse dialog box can display sharable resources on remote systems. This is intended for applications that want to expose remote shares on a local system.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.BIFlags.BIF_BROWSEFILEJUNCTIONS
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Allow folder junctions such as a library or a compressed file with a .zip file name extension to be browsed.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.Wininet
member.summary: API of wininet.dll.

member.name: M:MGS.WinLibrary.Wininet.InternetGetConnectedState(System.UInt32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the connected state of the local system.
member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the connection description.
This parameter is reserved and must be 0.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if there is an active modem or a LAN Internet connection, or FALSE if there is no Internet connection, or if all possible Internet connections are not currently active.

member.name: T:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags
member.summary: Flags of internet connected state of the local system.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_CONFIGURED
member.summary: Local system has a valid connection to the Internet, but it might or might not be currently connected.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_LAN
member.summary: Local system uses a local area network to connect to the Internet.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_MODEM
member.summary: Local system uses a modem to connect to the Internet.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_MODEM_BUSY
member.summary: No longer used.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_OFFLINE
member.summary: Local system is in offline mode.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_CONNECTION_PROXY
member.summary: Local system uses a proxy server to connect to the Internet.

member.name: F:MGS.WinLibrary.InetFlags.INTERNET_RAS_INSTALLED
member.summary: Local system has RAS installed.
